    Creating a tabular-data-resource Frictionless Standards Reading a tabular-data-resource

Reading a tabular-data-resource

Source: vignettes/read_fr_tdr.Rmd
read_fr_tdr.Rmd
library(fr)

The {fr} package comes with an example frictionless tabular-data-resource (tdr) named hamilton_poverty_2020. On disk, a tdr is composed of a folder containing a data CSV file (both named based on the name of the tdr) and a tabular-data-resource.yaml file, which contains the metadata descriptors:

fs::dir_tree(fs::path_package("fr", "hamilton_poverty_2020"), recurse = TRUE)
#> /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/fr/hamilton_poverty_2020
#> ├── hamilton_poverty_2020.csv
#> └── tabular-data-resource.yaml

Read the hamilton_poverty_2020 tdr into R by specifying the location of the tabular-data-resource file:

d_fr <- read_fr_tdr(
  fs::path_package(
    "fr",
    "hamilton_poverty_2020",
    "tabular-data-resource.yaml"
  )
)

Print the returned fr_tdr (frictionless tabular-data-resource) object to view all of the table-specific metadata descriptors and the underlying data frame:

d_fr
#> # name: hamilton_poverty_2020
#> # version: 0.0.1
#> # title: Hamilton County Poverty Rates in 2020
#> # A tibble: 226 × 3
#>    census_tract_id_2020  year fraction_poverty
#>    <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl>
#>  1 39061021508           2020            0.057
#>  2 39061021421           2020            0.031
#>  3 39061023300           2020            0.03 
#>  4 39061002000           2020            0.098
#>  5 39061002500           2020            0.442
#>  6 39061007700           2020            0.603
#>  7 39061009902           2020            0.15 
#>  8 39061010700           2020            0.15 
#>  9 39061023902           2020            0.013
#> 10 39061022301           2020            0.247
#> # ℹ 216 more rows

Use str() (or tibble::glimpse()) to view all field- and table-specific metadata:

tibble::glimpse(d_fr)
#> <fr_tdr>
#>  @ name       : chr "hamilton_poverty_2020"
#>  @ path       : chr "hamilton_poverty_2020.csv"
#>  @ version    : chr "0.0.1"
#>  @ title      : chr "Hamilton County Poverty Rates in 2020"
#>  @ homepage   : chr(0) 
#>  @ description: chr(0) 
#>  @ schema     : <fr_schema>
#>  .. @ fields       :List of 3
#>  .. .. $ census_tract_id_2020: <fr_field>
#>  .. ..  ..@ name       : chr "census_tract_id_2020"
#>  .. ..  ..@ type       : chr "string"
#>  .. ..  ..@ title      : chr "Census Tract Identifier"
#>  .. ..  ..@ description: chr "refers to 2020 vintage census tracts identifiers"
#>  .. ..  ..@ constraints: list()
#>  .. .. $ year                : <fr_field>
#>  .. ..  ..@ name       : chr "year"
#>  .. ..  ..@ type       : chr "integer"
#>  .. ..  ..@ title      : chr "Year"
#>  .. ..  ..@ description: chr "The year of the 5-year ACS estimates (e.g., the 2019 ACS covers 2015 - 2019)"
#>  .. ..  ..@ constraints: list()
#>  .. .. $ fraction_poverty    : <fr_field>
#>  .. ..  ..@ name       : chr "fraction_poverty"
#>  .. ..  ..@ type       : chr "number"
#>  .. ..  ..@ title      : chr "Fraction of Households in Poverty"
#>  .. ..  ..@ description: chr "Fraction of households with income below poverty level within the past 12 months"
#>  .. ..  ..@ constraints: list()
#>  .. @ missingValues: chr(0) 
#>  .. @ primaryKey   : chr(0) 
#>  .. @ foreignKeys  : chr(0) 
#>  @ data       : spc_tbl_ [226 × 3] (S3: spec_tbl_df/tbl_df/tbl/data.frame)
#>  $ census_tract_id_2020: chr [1:226] "39061021508" "39061021421" "39061023300" "39061002000" ...
#>  $ year                : num [1:226] 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 ...
#>  $ fraction_poverty    : num [1:226] 0.057 0.031 0.03 0.098 0.442 0.603 0.15 0.15 0.013 0.247 ...
#>  - attr(*, "spec")=
#>   .. cols(
#>   ..   census_tract_id_2020 = col_character(),
#>   ..   year = col_number(),
#>   ..   fraction_poverty = col_number(),
#>   ..   .delim = ","
#>   .. )
#>  - attr(*, "problems")=<externalptr>

Convert the fr_tdr object to a list of metadata attributes for further processing:

as_list(d_fr) |>
  str()
#> List of 7
#>  $ name       : chr "hamilton_poverty_2020"
#>  $ path       : chr "hamilton_poverty_2020.csv"
#>  $ version    : chr "0.0.1"
#>  $ title      : chr "Hamilton County Poverty Rates in 2020"
#>  $ homepage   : chr(0) 
#>  $ description: chr(0) 
#>  $ schema     :List of 1
#>   ..$ fields:List of 3
#>   .. ..$ census_tract_id_2020:List of 4
#>   .. .. ..$ name       : chr "census_tract_id_2020"
#>   .. .. ..$ type       : chr "string"
#>   .. .. ..$ title      : chr "Census Tract Identifier"
#>   .. .. ..$ description: chr "refers to 2020 vintage census tracts identifiers"
#>   .. ..$ year                :List of 4
#>   .. .. ..$ name       : chr "year"
#>   .. .. ..$ type       : chr "integer"
#>   .. .. ..$ title      : chr "Year"
#>   .. .. ..$ description: chr "The year of the 5-year ACS estimates (e.g., the 2019 ACS covers 2015 - 2019)"
#>   .. ..$ fraction_poverty    :List of 4
#>   .. .. ..$ name       : chr "fraction_poverty"
#>   .. .. ..$ type       : chr "number"
#>   .. .. ..$ title      : chr "Fraction of Households in Poverty"
#>   .. .. ..$ description: chr "Fraction of households with income below poverty level within the past 12 months"

Accessor functions work as they do with data frames and tibbles:

d_fr$fraction_poverty
#>   [1] 0.057 0.031 0.030 0.098 0.442 0.603 0.150 0.150 0.013 0.247 0.297 0.256
#>  [13] 0.152 0.280 0.036 0.229 0.155 0.062 0.037 0.319 0.051 0.070 0.299 0.098

#> [193] 0.022 0.194 0.404 0.268 0.198 0.127 0.157 0.199 0.028 0.098 0.190 0.108
#> [205] 0.025 0.059 0.183 0.176 0.131 0.160 0.213 0.014 0.284 0.045 0.369 0.346
#> [217] 0.734 0.138 0.026 0.079 0.214 0.259 0.062 0.154 0.046 0.391
d_fr[["fraction_poverty"]] |> class()
#> [1] "numeric"
d_fr["fraction_poverty"] |> class()
#> [1] "numeric"

fr_tdr objects can be used mostly anywhere that the underlying data frame can be used because as.data.frame usually is used to coerce objects into data frames and works with fr_tdr objects:

lm(fraction_poverty ~ year, data = d_fr)
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = fraction_poverty ~ year, data = d_fr)
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept)         year  
#>      0.1729           NA

Explicitly convert the fr_tdr object to a tibble by dropping the metadata attributes using as_tibble, as_data_frame, or as.data.frame:

tibble::as_tibble(d_fr)
#> # A tibble: 226 × 3
#>    census_tract_id_2020  year fraction_poverty
#>    <chr>                <dbl>            <dbl>
#>  1 39061021508           2020            0.057
#>  2 39061021421           2020            0.031
#>  3 39061023300           2020            0.03 
#>  4 39061002000           2020            0.098
#>  5 39061002500           2020            0.442
#>  6 39061007700           2020            0.603
#>  7 39061009902           2020            0.15 
#>  8 39061010700           2020            0.15 
#>  9 39061023902           2020            0.013
#> 10 39061022301           2020            0.247
#> # ℹ 216 more rows
